snippet: A $1 billion program to bolster defenses for American allies in Eastern and Central Europe is announced, but nerves are still rattled by the crisis in neighboring Ukraine.
abstract: Pres Obama flies to Poland to unveil $1 billion security plan intended to demonstrate the United States' commitment to stand with Central and Eastern Europe against Russian aggression; visit arrives at tense time in region, with nerves still rattled by crisis in neighboring Ukraine.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and RICK LYMAN
byline.contributor: Joanna Berendt contributed reporting from Warsaw, and Helene Cooper from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: A $1 billion program to bolster defenses for American allies in Eastern and Central Europe is announced, but nerves are still rattled by the crisis in neighboring Ukraine.

headline.main: Obama, in Poland, Renews Commitment to Security
headline.print_headline: Obama, in Poland, Renews Commitment to Security
